title: Delta jet struck by lightning
text:
Delta jet struck by lightning Last updated 10:12, August 21 2015 YouTube/JackPerkins 
Jack Perkins posted this video on YouTube which shows a plane getting struck by lightning during a storm in Georgia. 
Jack Perkins was simply trying to show his wife why his flight was delayed. 
But in filming a fierce electrical storm over Atlanta's Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport, Perkins also managed to capture the exact moment that lightning struck a Delta Airlines passenger jet. 
The video shows heavy rain and planes lined up on the runway. A flash of lightning is seen hitting the tail end of the Delta jet as it sits on the tarmac. 
The incident happened so quickly that Perkins was not even aware he had captured the image until he watched the film later on, according to The Mirror . 
Perkins posted the video on YouTube, with the explanation: "While filming the line of planes all stacked up during a ground hold in Atlanta on 8/18/15, I happened to capture this direct lightning strike on a 737." 
Delta spokesman Morgan Durrant confirmed to CNN that lightning struck Las Vegas-bound Delta Flight 67 on Tuesday, as the Boeing 737-900R aircraft was in the takeoff queue in Atlanta. 
There were no reports of injuries among the 111 customers and six crew.
